item.title: Code Coverage in Python
item.description: What is Code Coverage? In short, Code Coverage testing is determining how much code is tested. Test coverage is a measured used to describe the degree to which source code of a program is executed when a particular test suits runs. — Wikipedia Code coverage - Wikipedia Why Test Code Coverage? Code coverage testing helps you to figure out how well your tests actually test your code. Especially when the code base is large, it lets you have a clear understanding of how well your tests have been written.

item.title: A List of Blogs
item.description: Here is a list of my favorite blogs written in English. I will keep updating the list. Computer Science/Software/Programming in general Coding Horror Home of Feross Aboukhadijeh » Feross.org Joel on Software Junior Dev Diaries — Sam Jarman Teach Yourself Computer Science Peter Norvig Self-Learning GitHub - jwasham/coding-interview-university: A complete computer science study plan to become a software engineer. Teach Yourself Computer Science Learning Programming GitHub - ossu/computer-science: Path to a free self-taught education in Computer Science!

item.title: Why Writing a Blog
item.description: I read posts on different blogs regularly. For example, Coding Horror Home of Feross Aboukhadijeh » Feross.org Joel on Software Building a great blog is a long-time commitment and it is not an easy one. It is difficult that you do not always know what you would want to write about. In addition, writing in English, which is not my native language, makes the posts not so clear and concise.
